derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the adjective sense 'having the power to draw off', and in the noun sense 'a word derived from another'): from French dérivatif, -ive, from Latin derivativus, from derivare (see derive)

entry.def: A derivative is something which has been developed or obtained from something else.

example.tran: 类似海洛因的罂粟籽制剂

example.ex: This isn't an entirely new car, but a new derivative of the Citroen XM.
example.tran: 这不是一款全新的车，而是雪铁龙XM系列的派生车型。

entry.tran: 模仿他人的;缺乏创意的
entry.def: If you say that something is derivative, you are criticizing it because it is not new or original but has been developed from something else.

example.tran: 他们沉闷乏味、缺乏创意的首张专辑

example.ex: A lot of what you see in stand-up comedy today is very derivative.
example.tran: 如今人们看到的单人喜剧表演好多内容都是沿袭前人。

means.word_mean: 1. the result of mathematical differentiation; the instantaneous change of one quantity relative to another; df(x)/dx
2. a financial instrument whose value is based on another security
3. (linguistics) a word that is derived from another word;
